title: Author of anonymous NYTimes op-ed to release tell-all book
text:
“A Warning,” scheduled to be released Nov. 19, will pick up where the op-ed left off and pledges to reveal behind-the-scenes details of Trump’s government. The identity of the author will remain anonymous.

Twelve, the book’s publishing company, said the author did not take an advance to write the book. If royalties are to be collected, the author plans to donate the profits “substantially” to non-profits focused on government accountability around the world, the publisher said.

The fallout of the original piece was swift, with the president tweeting that the author was “failing” and probably in the administration “for all the wrong reasons.”

“Does the so-called ‘Senior Administration Official’ really exist, or is it just the Failing New York Times with another phony source?” Trump tweeted on Sept. 5, 2018, the day the op-ed was published. “If the GUTLESS anonymous person does indeed exist, the Times must, for National Security purposes, turn him/her over to government at once!”

Sarah Huckabee Sanders, the White House press secretary at the time, called the author a “coward” and called for the anonymous source’s resignation.

Trump later tweeted: “TREASON?”

Trump frequently deploys those accusations about many of his critics on Twitter and elsewhere. One of the most recent recipients was the whistleblower central to his impeachment inquiry, whom he has called treasonous while questioning their authenticity.
